verses.verse: {To the Director: Upon machalath. {53:T A Heb. musical term} A Davidic instruction. {53:T Lit. maskil}} {The Fool and God's Response} d Fools say to themselves "There is no God." They are corrupt and commit iniquity; not one of them practices what is good.
God looks down from the heavens upon humanity {Lit. upon the sons of Adam} to see if anyone shows discernment as he searches for God.
All of them {So MT; DSS 4QPs a lack of them} have fallen away; together they have become corrupt; no one does what is good, not even one.
Will those who do evil ever learn? They devour my people like they devour bread, and never call on God.

There the Israelis {Lit. they} were seized with terror, when there was nothing to fear. For God scattered the bones of those who laid siege against you {So MT DSS 4QPs a ; LXX reads of men pleasers} you put them to shame, {So MT DSS 4QPs a ; LXX reads they were put to shame} for God rejected them.
Would that Israel's deliverance come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people, Jacob will rejoice and Israel will be glad. {Cf. Ps 14:1-7}
